benchmark_details.name: CoXQL (Conversational Explanation Query Language)
benchmark_details.overview: CoXQL is the first dataset in the NLP domain for user intent recognition in Conversational Explainable AI (ConvXAI), covering 31 intents and supporting a variety of XAI operations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset for explanation request parsing in ConvXAI systems and to improve explanation intent recognition.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The current complexity of user questions might be lower compared to other text-to-SQL datasets that involve complex SQL grammar.

data.source: Manually created and augmented user questions and SQL-like queries based on existing studies and datasets.
data.annotation: Annotated by three authors with a token-level inter-annotator agreement of Fleiss’ κ= 0.87.

methodology.calculation: Measured by comparing generated SQL-like queries with gold parses.
methodology.interpretation: High accuracy indicates better performance in intent recognition.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline achieved 44.25% accuracy using Nearest Neighbor.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted on various state-of-the-art LLMs and performance compared using different parsing strategies.
